usefulItems: parchment paper, airtight container, rolling pin, cling wrap, icing spatula, toothpick or skewer, wire rack, baking sheets (approx. 16 in. x 14 in.), piping bag and tip, oven
title: Chocolate Bourbons

ingredients.content: 4 oz unsalted butter, cut into pieces

preparations.content: Preheat oven to 325°F and line two baking sheets with parchment paper.
Place butter, light brown sugar and golden syrup into mixing bowl and whip <b>30 sec/speed 4<b>.

Add flour, cocoa powder, corn starch, 2 tbsp water and salt and mix <b>20 sec/speed 6<b>. Scrape down sides of mixing bowl with spatula and mix a further <b>20 sec/speed 6<b>, adding more water a teaspoon at a time until dough starts to clump together.

Tip dough out onto work surface and bring together into a ball. Between two pieces of cling wrap, roll dough out until ⅛ in. thick. Cut out rectangles (approx. 2 ¼ in. x 1 ¼ in.) using a sharp knife or cookie cutter. Using an icing spatula, transfer cookies to prepared baking sheets, placing at least ¾ inch apart.

Use a skewer to make shallow holes along the top of each cookie (2 rows of 5 is the traditional number). Bake for 10-12 minutes (325°F). Allow to rest on baking sheets for 5 minutes before transferring to a wire rack to cool and harden. Meanwhile, prepare filling.

Place butter, confectioners sugar, cocoa powder, vanilla extract and boiling water into mixing bowl and mix <b>20 sec/speed 4<b>. Scrape down sides of mixing bowl with spatula and mix a further <b>20 sec/speed 4<b>.

When cookies are cool, spread some filling onto the underside of a cookie (see Tip) and gently press another cookie on top. Repeat until all cookies are sandwiched together. Serve or store in an airtight container.

hintsAndTricks: A rectangle cookie cutter with dimensions (approx. 2¼ in. x 1¼ in.) can be used to save time.
A piping bag can be used to pipe filling on the underside of cookies.
Golden syrup can be purchased from Cost Plus World market or some Safeway stores.
